text.0: i was aforetime manu i was sūrya i am the sage kakṣīvān holy singer.
text.1: kutsa the son of Ārjuni i master i am the sapient uśanā behold me.
text.2: i have bestowed the earth upon the Ārya and rain upon the man who brings oblation.
text.3: i guided forth the loudlyroaring waters and the gods moved according to my pleasure.
text.4: in the wild joy of soma i demolished Śambaras forts ninetyandnine together.
text.5: and utterly the hundredth habitation when helping divodāsa atithigva.
text.6: before all birds be ranked this bird o maruts supreme of falcons be this fleetwinged falcon.
text.7: because strong pinioned with no car to bear him he brought to manu the godloved oblation.
text.8: when the bird brought it hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried.
text.9: swift he returned with sweetness of the soma and hence the falcon hath acquired his glory.
text.10: bearing the stalk the falcon speeding onward bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens.
text.11: friend of the gods brought grasping fast the soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest heaven.
text.12: the falcon took and brought the soma bearing thousand libations with him yea ten thousand.
text.13: the bold one left malignities behind him wise in wild joy of soma left the foolish.
